text: The Wise Judge
Not so very long ago, there was a nasty snake named Viper.
One day, Viper got stuck under a rock.
After a while, the snake saw a boy walking by.
In his most sugary voice, Viper said, "Little boy, please help me."
"What's wrong?" asked the boy, whose name was Francesco.
"I'm stuck under this rock," said Viper.
Now Francesco was afraid of the snake, but he didn't want it to die.
"Will you bite me?" he asked.
"Of course not," said Viper.
Francesco lifted up the rock, and Viper slithered out.
"There, you're free," said Francesco.
"Ah, much better. And now, I'm going to eat you," said the snake.
"What?" asked Francesco.
"That'sss right. I won't bite you, but I will eat you!" he said, laughing.
"But I helped you!" said Francesco.
"Yes," said Viper, "but I love tasty children."
Viper wrapped himself around the boy's legs.
"No!" cried Francesco.
Just as Viper was about to eat him, a wise owl flew over to them.
"Whoo-whoo," she called.
"Who's in trouble?"
Francesco said, "Owl, I helped Viper, but now he's going to eat me!"
"No, no," lied Viper.
"This boy stepped on my tail."
"Hmm ... Viper, you poor snake," said Owl, but she winked at the boy.
By that time, other animals had gathered around.
They didn't like Viper at all.
"You're the meanest snake in the woods," said Wolf.
"You're nothing but trouble," screeched Bird.
"You're no good!" snorted Boar.
"You're a sneaky snake!" said Deer.
"Friends," said Owl, "let me be the judge."
Everyone was quiet.
"Proceed," said Viper.
"Viper, what happened?" asked Owl.
"I was ssstuck under this rock," said Viper.
"Boar, can you lift the rock?" asked Owl.
"Of course," said Boar, and he did.
"Viper, show me how you were stuck," said Owl.
Viper slithered under the rock.
"Like thisss," said Viper.
"Deer, stand on this side of the rock," said Owl.
"Sure," said Deer, and she put two hooves on the rock.
"Ugh," the snake groaned.
"Wolf, stand on the other side," said Owl.
"Of course," said Wolf, and he put two paws on the rock.
"Are you stuck?" Owl asked Viper.
"Ugh ... yes!" Viper groaned.
The rock was pushed down tight, and Viper was stuck.
"Do you want to help him?" Owl asked Francesco.
"No!" said Francesco.
"Then let us leave the problem," said Owl.
So they left, and all the animals stepped on Viper's tail as they walked away.
"Get back here!" Viper hissed, but he couldn't do anything about it.
All the animals cheered for the wise Owl.
